title: Understanding Sigma Bonds
text: A sigma bond (σ) is formed by the head-on overlap of atomic orbitals, usually between s-orbitals or between an s-orbital and a $$p-orbital$$. Remember that every single bond contains one sigma bond.

title: Understanding Pi Bonds
text: A pi bond (pi) is formed by the side-to-side overlap of $$p-orbitals$$. Double and triple bonds contain pi bonds in addition to sigma bonds.
